oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Charles T. P. Tally
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Charles T. P. Tally, Co. C, 8th Tenn. Inf. Regt., USA was a farmer from Cocke County, Tenn. (Bybee area). He enlisted Jan. 1, 1863 at Camp Dick Robinson, Ky. His service records indicate that he was in the hospital at Camp Nelson, Ky. in July 1863.; Tally dies of typhoid fever on Sept. 24, 1863. The tintype shows Tally wearing a standard Federal army enlisted frock or dress coat. The listing of his effects at time of death includes a dress coat "expended in camp."
